<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// When creating runtime checks for nested loops, where possible try to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// write the checks in a form that allows them to be easily hoisted out of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the outermost loop. For example, we can do this by expanding the range of</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Checks memory dependences among accesses to the same underlying</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// object to determine whether there vectorization is legal or not (and at</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// which vectorization factor).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Note: This class will compute a conservative dependence for access to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// different underlying pointers. Clients, such as the loop vectorizer, will</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// sometimes deal these potential dependencies by emitting runtime checks.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// We use the ScalarEvolution framework to symbolically evalutate access</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// functions pairs. Since we currently don&#39;t restructure the loop we can rely</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// on the program order of memory accesses to determine their safety.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// At the moment we will only deem accesses as safe for:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  &#42; A negative constant distance assuming program order.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///      Safe: tmp = a&#91;i + 1&#93;;     OR     a&#91;i + 1&#93; = x;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///            a&#91;i&#93; = tmp;                y = a&#91;i&#93;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   The latter case is safe because later checks guarantuee that there can&#39;t</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   be a cycle through a phi node (that is, we check that &quot;x&quot; and &quot;y&quot; is not</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   the same variable: a header phi can only be an induction or a reduction, a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   reduction can&#39;t have a memory sink, an induction can&#39;t have a memory</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   source). This is important and must not be violated (or we have to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   resort to checking for cycles through memory).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  &#42; A positive constant distance assuming program order that is bigger</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    than the biggest memory access.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     tmp = a&#91;i&#93;        OR              b&#91;i&#93; = x</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     a&#91;i+2&#93; = tmp                      y = b&#91;i+2&#93;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     Safe distance: 2 x sizeof(a&#91;0&#93;), and 2 x sizeof(b&#91;0&#93;), respectively.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  &#42; Zero distances and all accesses have the same size.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorydepchecker"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorydepchecker/#a7610f9bf36472cdb43096b7bcafd0a89">MemoryDepChecker</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorydepchecker/#adb2762f61b5d5d514cdb7f650e23f617"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typedef</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pointerintpair">PointerIntPair&lt;Value &#42;, 1, bool&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorydepchecker/#adb2762f61b5d5d514cdb7f650e23f617">MemAccessInfo</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorydepchecker/#abc943f0e03dddf08da437eab00bcd8e6"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typedef</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;MemAccessInfo, 8&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorydepchecker/#abc943f0e03dddf08da437eab00bcd8e6">MemAccessInfoList</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Set of potential dependent memory accesses.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorydepchecker/#a4eb0c14b923c59b75a82bc41e03c2575"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typedef</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/equivalenceclasses">EquivalenceClasses&lt;MemAccessInfo&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorydepchecker/#a4eb0c14b923c59b75a82bc41e03c2575">DepCandidates</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Type to keep track of the status of the dependence check. The order of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the elements is important and has to be from most permissive to least</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// permissive.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorydepchecker/#ac661dd363bcde8b1e9516390eff1c400"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">enum class</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorydepchecker/#ac661dd363bcde8b1e9516390eff1c400">VectorizationSafetyStatus</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Can vectorize safely without RT checks. All dependences are known to be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// safe.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorydepchecker/#ac661dd363bcde8b1e9516390eff1c400ac6eea0560cd6f377e78dff2c85cc9122"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorydepchecker/#ac661dd363bcde8b1e9516390eff1c400ac6eea0560cd6f377e78dff2c85cc9122">Safe</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Can possibly vectorize with RT checks to overcome unknown dependencies.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorydepchecker/#ac661dd363bcde8b1e9516390eff1c400ad1b0fb720d53739ff1265c71d6977de8"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorydepchecker/#ac661dd363bcde8b1e9516390eff1c400ad1b0fb720d53739ff1265c71d6977de8">PossiblySafeWithRtChecks</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Cannot vectorize due to known unsafe dependencies.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Dependece between memory access instructions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/memorydepchecker/dependence"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/memorydepchecker/dependence/#a40efa3de48a570060d0db38b654d9ea3">Dependence</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// The type of the dependence.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/memorydepchecker/dependence/#ae336b0e8514b99a44e73c3e2494c3cea"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">enum</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/memorydepchecker/dependence/#ae336b0e8514b99a44e73c3e2494c3cea">DepType</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// No dependence.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/memorydepchecker/dependence/#ae336b0e8514b99a44e73c3e2494c3ceaae12470995d757ddbebbd627f397fe349"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/memorydepchecker/dependence/#ae336b0e8514b99a44e73c3e2494c3ceaae12470995d757ddbebbd627f397fe349">NoDep</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We couldn&#39;t determine the direction or the distance.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/memorydepchecker/dependence/#ae336b0e8514b99a44e73c3e2494c3ceaa3d96a899c885f75def67055e4b486dab"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/memorydepchecker/dependence/#ae336b0e8514b99a44e73c3e2494c3ceaa3d96a899c885f75def67055e4b486dab">Unknown</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// At least one of the memory access instructions may access a loop</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// varying object, e.g. the address of underlying object is loaded inside</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the loop, like A&#91;B&#91;i&#93;&#93;. We cannot determine direction or distance in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// those cases, and also are unable to generate any runtime checks.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/memorydepchecker/dependence/#ae336b0e8514b99a44e73c3e2494c3ceaa006edf4988ecca6989849eb1e4b92662"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/memorydepchecker/dependence/#ae336b0e8514b99a44e73c3e2494c3ceaa006edf4988ecca6989849eb1e4b92662">IndirectUnsafe</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Lexically forward.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// FIXME: If we only have loop-independent forward dependences (e.g. a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// read and write of A&#91;i&#93;), LAA will locally deem the dependence &quot;safe&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// without querying the MemoryDepChecker.  Therefore we can miss</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// enumerating loop-independent forward dependences in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// getDependences.  Note that as soon as there are different</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// indices used to access the same array, the MemoryDepChecker &#42;is&#42;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// queried and the dependence list is complete.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/memorydepchecker/dependence/#ae336b0e8514b99a44e73c3e2494c3ceaa0e2ea83a39804701390079f7d07ed112"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/memorydepchecker/dependence/#ae336b0e8514b99a44e73c3e2494c3ceaa0e2ea83a39804701390079f7d07ed112">Forward</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Forward, but if vectorized, is likely to prevent store-to-load</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// forwarding.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/memorydepchecker/dependence/#ae336b0e8514b99a44e73c3e2494c3ceaaec0ae061c48cbea01461ccb40dbc4c7a"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/memorydepchecker/dependence/#ae336b0e8514b99a44e73c3e2494c3ceaaec0ae061c48cbea01461ccb40dbc4c7a">ForwardButPreventsForwarding</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Lexically backward.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/memorydepchecker/dependence/#ae336b0e8514b99a44e73c3e2494c3ceaa4af323986f2ce2d7f10399fe8997096b"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/memorydepchecker/dependence/#ae336b0e8514b99a44e73c3e2494c3ceaa4af323986f2ce2d7f10399fe8997096b">Backward</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Backward, but the distance allows a vectorization factor of dependent</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// on MinDepDistBytes.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/memorydepchecker/dependence/#ae336b0e8514b99a44e73c3e2494c3ceaa2a42f6e575ea09a8ee7c396bf3821b4d"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/memorydepchecker/dependence/#ae336b0e8514b99a44e73c3e2494c3ceaa2a42f6e575ea09a8ee7c396bf3821b4d">BackwardVectorizable</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Same, but may prevent store-to-load forwarding.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/memorydepchecker/dependence/#ae336b0e8514b99a44e73c3e2494c3ceaa219afbca7ad4b6a18f20c507b7b12353"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/memorydepchecker/dependence/#ae336b0e8514b99a44e73c3e2494c3ceaa219afbca7ad4b6a18f20c507b7b12353">BackwardVectorizableButPreventsForwarding</a></span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// String version of the types.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="195"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Check whether the dependencies between the accesses are safe.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="196"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="197"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Only checks sets with elements in \\p CheckDeps.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="198"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorydepchecker/#a2e54d4cd15784b0f0480ca88bcf3165f">areDepsSafe</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorydepchecker/#a4eb0c14b923c59b75a82bc41e03c2575">DepCandidates</a> &amp;AccessSets,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// No memory dependence was encountered that would inhibit</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Return true if the number of elements that are safe to operate on</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="339"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="340"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Check whether there is a plausible dependence between the two</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="341"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// accesses.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="342"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="343"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Access \\p A must happen before \\p B in program order. The two indices</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="344"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// identify the index into the program order map.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="345"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="346"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This function checks  whether there is a plausible dependence (or the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="347"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// absence of such can&#39;t be proved) between the two accesses. If there is a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="348"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// plausible dependence but the dependence distance is bigger than one</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00349" /><CodeLine lineNumber="349"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// element access it records this distance in \\p MinDepDistBytes (if this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="350"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// distance is smaller than any other distance encountered so far).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00351" /><CodeLine lineNumber="351"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Otherwise, this function returns true signaling a possible dependence.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00352" /><CodeLine lineNumber="352"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/memorydepchecker/dependence/#ae336b0e8514b99a44e73c3e2494c3cea">Dependence::DepType</a> isDependent(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorydepchecker/#adb2762f61b5d5d514cdb7f650e23f617">MemAccessInfo</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> AIdx,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00353" /><CodeLine lineNumber="353"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorydepchecker/#adb2762f61b5d5d514cdb7f650e23f617">MemAccessInfo</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#ae76959fe811ba090de4cba69ac00f1da">B</a>, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> BIdx);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00354" /><CodeLine lineNumber="354"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00614" /><CodeLine lineNumber="614"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00615" /><CodeLine lineNumber="615"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Drive the analysis of memory accesses in the loop</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00616" /><CodeLine lineNumber="616"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00617" /><CodeLine lineNumber="617"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This class is responsible for analyzing the memory accesses of a loop.  It</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00618" /><CodeLine lineNumber="618"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// collects the accesses and then its main helper the AccessAnalysis class</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00619" /><CodeLine lineNumber="619"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// finds and categorizes the dependences in buildDependenceSets.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00620" /><CodeLine lineNumber="620"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00621" /><CodeLine lineNumber="621"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// For memory dependences that can be analyzed at compile time, it determines</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00622" /><CodeLine lineNumber="622"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// whether the dependence is part of cycle inhibiting vectorization.  This work</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00623" /><CodeLine lineNumber="623"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// is delegated to the MemoryDepChecker class.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00624" /><CodeLine lineNumber="624"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00625" /><CodeLine lineNumber="625"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// For memory dependences that cannot be determined at compile time, it</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00626" /><CodeLine lineNumber="626"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// generates run-time checks to prove independence.  This is done by</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00627" /><CodeLine lineNumber="627"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// AccessAnalysis::canCheckPtrAtRT and the checks are maintained by the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00628" /><CodeLine lineNumber="628"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// RuntimePointerCheck class.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00629" /><CodeLine lineNumber="629"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00630" /><CodeLine lineNumber="630"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If pointers can wrap or can&#39;t be expressed as affine AddRec expressions by</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00631" /><CodeLine lineNumber="631"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ScalarEvolution, we will generate run-time checks by emitting a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00632" /><CodeLine lineNumber="632"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// SCEVUnionPredicate.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00633" /><CodeLine lineNumber="633"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00634" /><CodeLine lineNumber="634"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Checks for both memory dependences and the SCEV predicates contained in the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00635" /><CodeLine lineNumber="635"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// PSE must be emitted in order for the results of this analysis to be valid.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00636" /><CodeLine lineNumber="636" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopaccessinfo"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopaccessinfo/#af7d561e1175f661ea1725d1026a10677">LoopAccessInfo</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00804" /><CodeLine lineNumber="804"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00805" /><CodeLine lineNumber="805"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If the pointer has a constant stride return it in units of the access type</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00806" /><CodeLine lineNumber="806"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// size. If the pointer is loop-invariant, return 0 Otherwise return</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00807" /><CodeLine lineNumber="807"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// std::nullopt.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00808" /><CodeLine lineNumber="808"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00809" /><CodeLine lineNumber="809"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Ensure that it does not wrap in the address space, assuming the predicate</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00810" /><CodeLine lineNumber="810"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// associated with \\p PSE is true.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00811" /><CodeLine lineNumber="811"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00812" /><CodeLine lineNumber="812"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If necessary this method will version the stride of the pointer according</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00813" /><CodeLine lineNumber="813"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// to \\p PtrToStride and therefore add further predicates to \\p PSE.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00814" /><CodeLine lineNumber="814"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The \\p Assume parameter indicates if we are allowed to make additional</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00815" /><CodeLine lineNumber="815"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// run-time assumptions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00816" /><CodeLine lineNumber="816"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00817" /><CodeLine lineNumber="817"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Note that the analysis results are defined if-and-only-if the original</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00818" /><CodeLine lineNumber="818"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// memory access was defined.  If that access was dead, or UB, then the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00819" /><CodeLine lineNumber="819"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// result of this function is undefined.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00820" /><CodeLine lineNumber="820"><span class="doxyHighlight">std::optional&lt;int64&#95;t&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00821" /><CodeLine lineNumber="821"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a8021a49018596bcbea563e6d5cac9a70">getPtrStride</a>(PredicatedScalarEvolution &amp;PSE, Type &#42;AccessTy, Value &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/targetlibraryinfo-cpp/#aca185e6d0e9f423dbb24440206454872a11dbf501abf829b3ab7049c2d3a8a053">Ptr</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00822" /><CodeLine lineNumber="822"><span class="doxyHighlight">             </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Loop &#42;Lp,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00824" /><CodeLine lineNumber="824"><span class="doxyHighlight">             </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Assume = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ShouldCheckWrap = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">true</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00825" /><CodeLine lineNumber="825"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00826" /><CodeLine lineNumber="826"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Returns the distance between the pointers \\p PtrA and \\p PtrB iff they are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00827" /><CodeLine lineNumber="827"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// compatible and it is possible to calculate the distance between them. This</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00839" /><CodeLine lineNumber="839"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00840" /><CodeLine lineNumber="840"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Returns &#39;true&#39; if sorting is legal, otherwise returns &#39;false&#39;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00841" /><CodeLine lineNumber="841"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00842" /><CodeLine lineNumber="842"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// For example, for a given \\p VL of memory accesses in program order, a&#91;i+4&#93;,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00851" /><CodeLine lineNumber="851"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Returns true if the memory operations \\p A and \\p B are consecutive.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00852" /><CodeLine lineNumber="852"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This is a simple API that does not depend on the analysis pass.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00855" /><CodeLine lineNumber="855"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00856" /><CodeLine lineNumber="856"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Calculate Start and End points of memory access.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00857" /><CodeLine lineNumber="857"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Let&#39;s assume A is the first access and B is a memory access on N-th loop</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00858" /><CodeLine lineNumber="858"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// iteration. Then B is calculated as:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00859" /><CodeLine lineNumber="859"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   B = A + Step&#42;N .</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00860" /><CodeLine lineNumber="860"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Step value may be positive or negative.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00861" /><CodeLine lineNumber="861"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// N is a calculated back-edge taken count:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00862" /><CodeLine lineNumber="862"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     N = (TripCount &gt; 0) ? RoundDown(TripCount -1 , VF) : 0</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00863" /><CodeLine lineNumber="863"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Start and End points are calculated in the following way:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00864" /><CodeLine lineNumber="864"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Start = UMIN(A, B) ; End = UMAX(A, B) + SizeOfElt,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00865" /><CodeLine lineNumber="865"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// where SizeOfElt is the size of single memory access in bytes.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00866" /><CodeLine lineNumber="866"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00867" /><CodeLine lineNumber="867"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// There is no conflict when the intervals are disjoint:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00868" /><CodeLine lineNumber="868"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// NoConflict = (P2.Start &gt;= P1.End) || (P1.Start &gt;= P2.End)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00869" /><CodeLine lineNumber="869"><span class="doxyHighlight">std::pair&lt;const SCEV &#42;, const SCEV &#42;&gt; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#afdd1ebe6412f9afb43d0639420afffe0">getStartAndEndForAccess</a>(</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00870" /><CodeLine lineNumber="870"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Loop &#42;Lp, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> SCEV &#42;PtrExpr, Type &#42;AccessTy, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> SCEV &#42;MaxBECount,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00871" /><CodeLine lineNumber="871"><span class="doxyHighlight">    ScalarEvolution &#42;SE,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00872" /><CodeLine lineNumber="872"><span class="doxyHighlight">    DenseMap&lt;std::pair&lt;const SCEV &#42;, Type &#42;&gt;,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00873" /><CodeLine lineNumber="873"><span class="doxyHighlight">             std::pair&lt;const SCEV &#42;, const SCEV &#42;&gt;&gt; &#42;<a href="/docs/api/structs/pointerbounds">PointerBounds</a>);</span></CodeLine>
